decks.notes: The key focus of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, card draw, and disruption. With a low mana curve and efficient spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. By including powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, as well as versatile threats like Lurrus of the Dream-Den, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck revolves around utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures to dominate the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent access to powerful cards. The deck also features powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, alongside disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters. With a mix of efficient removal, disruptive creatures, and powerful card advantage, this Esper Control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then bring them back to the battlefield with cards like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to manipulate the graveyard, the deck can achieve explosive starts and overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient board presence. The inclusion of disruption spells like Force of Will and Grief also helps to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' game plans.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing small but disruptive creatures to slow down the opponent while applying pressure. The deck includes powerful hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with cards like Chancellor of the Annex to further hinder their strategies. The deck also features ramp elements like Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland. The goal is to control the game while building a strong board presence to quickly close out the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful control spells and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck includes a strong counterspell package with Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes Mishra's Bauble and Vexing Bauble for additional card draw and disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent to secure the win.

This deck revolves around using Doomsday to set up a specific sequence of cards to win the game quickly. It includes various tutors and draw spells to find the necessary pieces, as well as disruption in the form of counterspells. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo and use Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck utilizes powerful vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall to generate mana and draw cards quickly, allowing for explosive plays and game-ending combos.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Troll of Khazad-dûm, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also uses disruption spells like Grief, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Show and Tell allows for explosive plays and alternative ways to cheat creatures into play. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and win the game before they can establish their own board presence.

The key focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards such as Ichorid, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp, allowing for powerful graveyard interactions like reanimating Prized Amalgam and using Bridge from Below. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, the deck can set up its graveyard effectively and efficiently. The deck also has some disruptive elements with Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win through graveyard recursion and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and combos.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-Fish deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Black Lotus to generate card advantage and tempo advantage over the opponent. With a low mana curve and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Questing Druid, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of key threats and provides additional value throughout the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Doomsday to set up a game-winning combo by stacking your deck with key cards like Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. It focuses on fast mana acceleration like Mox Jet and Dark Ritual to quickly execute the combo and control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for combo pieces efficiently. Overall, the strategy is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible while protecting your game plan from disruption.
